testimony.name: Andrea Goldwyn
key_points: Concerns about the rushed process and lack of meaningful public outreach
Opposition to removing ULURP requirements for many land use actions
Support for easing rules for converting commercial buildings to residential
Appreciation for new opportunities for landmarks to transfer unused development rights
Concern about potential impacts on older buildings and special districts
Worry about prioritizing new construction over green spaces and backyards
Skepticism about the proposal's ability to create affordable housing
Request for more time for residents to learn about the implications of the proposal

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: It's hard to see how many will opt to create affordable units with UAP bonuses.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote directly mentions UAP bonuses, which refers to the Universal Affordability Preference element of the proposal. The speaker is expressing skepticism about the effectiveness of this element in creating affordable housing.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: So we appreciate the rules for conversions of commercial buildings for residential will be eased.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote directly addresses the residential conversions element of the proposal. The speaker acknowledges that the proposal will make it easier to convert commercial buildings into residential spaces.
